description: From Middle English hogget, from Anglo-Norman hoget and an Anglo-Latin hogettus.

entries.meaning: (chiefly UK, New Zealand) A young colt or sheep of either gender from about 9 to 18 months of age (until it cuts 2 teeth).
examples: They were kept in separate flocks; first there were the hoggets, then the oldest of the younger lambs and lastly the very young ones all kept apart from one another  [â€¦]

entries.meaning: (chiefly UK, New Zealand) The meat of a young sheep.
(chiefly UK) A young boar of the second year.
